text:
Situation B. Similar Triangles

These two triangles are similar. Find all the missing side lengths and angles. Explain your reasoning.

The scale factor from one figure to the other is 7.5 ÷ 6, or 1.25. Side DF is 3.75 cm since 3 × 1.25 is 3.75. Side FE is 6.25 cm (5 × 1.25 = 6.25). Because the triangles are similar, the corresponding angle measures are the same. So, the measure of angle F is 94°. Angle B and corresponding angle E are each 30° since 180 – (94 + 56) = 30. Note: Students will need to use the fact that the sum of the interior angles of a triangle is 180°.
